6_13hcYDp4XW3GQo4LMtmPf8qUZLZcxFSmVw.body:
Bump
Why do we need a centralized identification service in order to participate in a decentralized network?
Does it prevent anything? Does it provide any value to the network?

1_1B31nupRZTHN6viJa2wCQqDngZPoBP4hVt.body:
You can actually [query using SQL](127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/) (search for "dbQuery")

Sites are developed using browser JavaScript and the ZeroFrame API.
You can generate JSON files for the data, and map that JSON into a database using `dbschema.json` 

Things you can do: 
* Look how PLAY works (open the `data` folder in your ZeroNet folder and look for `1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp` ). 
* Follow @nofish's tutorial [part 1](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:43:ZeroNet+site+development+tutorial+1) and [part 2](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:46:ZeroNet+site+development+tutorial+2)
* Look at the [ZeroNet documentation](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe)
